attributes.action: make any future resignation honours list apolitical and to honour the most deserving.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There has been press coverage that people are being considered for honours in the Prime Ministers resignation honours list should he be defeated at the next election or resign before that time.  

I call upon the Prime minister to state publicly that:

The wife of the last Prime Minister will not be elevated to the House of Lords.  Far greater and more deserving people then ex prime ministers wives exist in this country.

No member of parliament or elected official will be honoured in any way if they have been asked to repay any expenses irrespective of whether they have done so.  To give such people honours would appear to be rewarding either dishonesty or, in the case of a genuine mistake, rewarding negligence.  I do not believe that the British people would want to see either.

And finally, that any resignation honours will be apolitical and used to honour people who have served the public selflessly, charitably and in a non political way.
